title: Font used in a Crossfit Primal Logo
content:
| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Screen shot 2013-12-12 at 7.37.18 PM.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20140307103242/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20shot%202013-12-12%20at%207.37.18%20PM.png) | 14.52 KB |
| [Screen shot 2013-12-12 at 7.41.59 PM.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20140307103242/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20shot%202013-12-12%20at%207.41.59%20PM.png) | 15.3 KB |
author: evahofer

comments.content: This is font used in a crossfit primal logo. Any help would be appreciated!

This is **[God Of War](http://web.archive.org/web/20140307103242/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Dafont-1&ffam=GodOfWar%20-%20Regular&fid=3db637d5fec2731f72520724c0d3db9d&fsize=60&text=PC&fit=1)** (from Dafont.com) but I can't find any info on the designer or licensing.

Good find Fivos. God of War (2010) seems to be a creative and highly edited pastiche of Miller (1997) [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/miller/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140307103242/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/miller/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/miller/") or a similar Scotch Roman, for most of the letters and other fonts, such as Bodoni for the Q.  
Don
